entries.title: Pitching in 2023 World Baseball Classic moment of growth for Cubs' Javier Assad
entries.summary: <p>MESA, Ariz. — The Cubs already have one player who used the World Baseball Classic to take a leap forward in his development.</p><p>Right-hander <b>Javier Assad</b> was coming off his debut MLB season, with only nine games under his belt, entering the 2023 WBC. He left Cubs camp to pitch for Mexico and proved what a difference-maker he could be in a multi-inning relief role. He allowed only two hits in 5⅔ scoreless innings in the course of the tournament.</p><p>‘‘Big moments against great teams,’’ Mexico manager <b>Benji Gil</b> said of Assad’s outings against the United States in pool play and Puerto Rico in the quarterfinals. ‘‘There’s a handful of guys in the world that have faced the lineups he just faced and dominated.’’</p><p>Much of the talk about the WBC centers on the honor the players feel to represent their countries and on the challenges the schedule presents as teams gear up for the regular season. For many players, however, the big-game atmosphere has its developmental advantages, as well.</p><p>‘‘If you can get to the final rounds, those games are just so much fun that you get to re-create feelings that you have in October games,’’ Cubs manager <b>Craig Counsell</b> said. ‘‘And those are invaluable experiences.’’</p><p>The WBC has more MLB star power this year than ever — quite literally. A record 78 MLB All-Stars, including 36 who got the nod last season, were featured on rosters as of Feb. 5. Thirteen players from the Cubs’ organization are set to participate.</p><p>Assad is one of them, and he’s expected to play an even larger role for Mexico in this tournament.</p><p>‘‘Last time, it was a really great experience, really happy with it,’’ Assad said through an interpreter. ‘‘And I’ll go on to this one looking for new goals in the tournament.’’</p><p>Said Gil: ‘‘I’m just really looking forward to him pitching for us and then afterwards going and establishing himself as one of the better pitchers in the National League.’’</p><h3>Outfield competition</h3><p>The Cubs’ position-player group is largely set, but the competition for bench roles — and particularly a potential spot for a fourth outfielder — will be something to watch.</p><p><b>Matt Shaw</b> has been taking fly balls in the outfield in preparation for a super-utility role and certainly will factor into the equation. Outside of the Cubs’ three regular starters — left fielder <b>Ian Happ</b>, center fielder <b>Pete Crow-Armstrong</b> and right fielder <b>Seiya Suzuki</b> — the Cubs have five other outfielders in camp.</p><p><b>Kevin Alcantara</b> and <b>Justin Dean</b>, whom the Cubs claimed off waivers this offseason, are on the 40-man roster. <b>Brett Bateman</b>, <b>Dylan Carlson</b> and <b>Chas McCormick</b> are non-roster invitees.</p><p><b>Tyler Austin</b> has played outfield in his career and likely will take fly balls as the Cubs make contingency plans, but Counsell said he sees Austin more as a first baseman.</p><h3>Lefty options</h3><p>The Cubs’ bullpen featured three left-handers for stretches of last season, giving Counsell more options against left-handed-heavy lineups. They have five left-handed relievers in camp this year, including returnee <b>Caleb Thielbar</b> and offseason additions <b>Hoby Milner</b> and <b>Ryan Rolison</b>.<br></p>
entries.author: Maddie Lee

entries.title: Shedd Aquarium’s anti-Valentine’s Day event allows cynics, singles to de-stress in nature
entries.summary: <p>There are those who spend Valentine’s Day wining and dining, and then there are those who spend it raging.</p><p>A Shedd Aquarium event at LaGrange Park Woods on Saturday catered to the latter group. About 15 participants burned off steam by snapping, sawing and burning buckthorn, an invasive tree threatening native plants and wildlife in the area.</p><p>Ten-year-old Gideon Majka-Lauterbach grunted as he sliced through thick trunks and hauled large armfuls of the wood to a crackling pyre.</p><p>“To be honest, Valentine's Day is my least favorite holiday,” he said, eliciting a chuckle out of his mother, Meg Lauterbach, 48, of Brookfield.</p><p>“He’s anti-love,” she said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-6b0000" name="image-6b0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/f4f20c4/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/5632503/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Gideon Majka-Lauterbach, 10, drags a tree branch to a fire. "To be honest, Valentine's Day is my least favorite holiday," he says." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/80a612e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/67dda56/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5934x3330+0+313/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1e%2F38%2F92f1366b4ccf9ddd47b727039e54%2Fvalentinerage-260215-7.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Gideon Majka-Lauterbach, 10, drags a tree branch to a fire. “To be honest, Valentine’s Day is my least favorite holiday,” he says.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Branded as an “anti-Valentine’s Day” affair in “nature’s rage room,” the event was part of the aquarium’s regular “<a class="Link" href="https://www.sheddaquarium.org/care-and-conservation/take-action-for-animals/shedd-aquarium-action-days" target="_blank" >action days</a>” to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural areas. Volunteers included everyone from singles to groups of friends to couples. They worked for a few hours atop an ephemeral pond, which is dry during winter months. And they were rewarded with cookies, a heart-shaped box of chocolates, lollipops and s’mores.</p><p>Though participants admitted to the stress-relief benefits of the activity, no one was especially angry or broken-hearted. They were more interested in the opportunity to spend Valentine’s Day in a unique way and do their part to help the environment.</p><p>“We don't do Valentine's Day, so this is great,” said Kathy Nagy, 62, of the South Loop, who attended with her husband, Michael. “It's a Hallmark holiday. You go out to dinner and get ushered out within 45 minutes because everybody has a waiting list. It's overpriced. This is not how we show love.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-660000" name="image-660000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b7e4758/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/7893caa/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Meg Lauterbach, a frequent volunteer, carries European buckthorn. The Shedd volunteers, couples, singles and friend groups, work to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural habitats." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1f0cd4b/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ed4a4ef/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5608x3147+0+296/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fce%2F02%2F2ff111a0410daa34ef0343740257%2Fvalentinerage-260215-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Meg Lauterbach, a frequent volunteer, carries European buckthorn. The Shedd volunteers, couples, singles and friend groups, work to restore and safeguard forest preserves and other natural habitats.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Buckthorn emits a toxic chemical called emodin. Clearing the invasive tree allows bottlebrush, wood reed grass and Joy Pyre weed to flourish in the soil and toads, frogs and salamanders to thrive in the pond. The volunteers made an impressive amount of headway toward this effort at Saturday’s event, which was marketed in a playful way to entice people to experience the natural areas in their communities, said Evelyn Alvarez, the coordinator of conservation action at Shedd Aquarium.</p><p>“It's a really fun and engaging way to get people to learn about the harmful things in our environment, what they can do to make an impact for their local spaces, and also a really great way to connect with other people with similar interests,” she said.</p><p>Antonio Marquez and Kayla Reum said throwing the trees on the fire was the best part of the day. The two teenagers attended with a group of friends. Reum dyed her hair pink for the occasion, and Marquez’s jeans with flaming pink hearts were chosen unintentionally.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-5c0000" name="image-5c0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/3a0bef5/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/94c9c38/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Antonio Marquez (right) throws a piece of European buckthorn into a pile after cutting it on Valentine’s Day during Shedd Aquarium’s volunteer action days at LaGrange Park Woods in La Grange, Ill., Saturday, Feb. 14, 2026." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/18152b1/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1c43153/2147483647/strip/true/crop/4675x2624+0+247/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fd5%2F7f%2F391fa1a74632863c65523c5492e2%2Fvalentinerage-260215-20.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Antonio Marquez (right) throws a piece of European buckthorn into a pile after cutting it on Valentine’s Day. “I’m just trying to do my part for the community,” he said.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“I’m just trying to do my part for the community,” said Marquez, 19, of La Grange Park. “It’s nice to come out here and make a difference. And it's Valentine's Day. I didn't have anything planned, so I might as well hang out with all the homies.”</p><p>Marquez also praised the instant gratification of eradicating the buckthorn.</p><p>“I'm seeing all these mushrooms,” he said. “It’s like you're making a way for more nature, and it's beautiful.”</p><p>Abbey Hays said the activity did allow her to work through some emotions, though they weren’t tied to romance.</p><p>“It’s just the aggression of not really knowing how to exist in this world as a young woman, and the standards changing so fast,” said Hays, 28, of Pilsen, who has participated in similar conservation efforts. “I love to be outdoors. I usually lead crews. And not everybody likes that in a woman. Not everybody expects that in a woman.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-be0000" name="image-be0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/5c464ba/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1d163a2/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Abbey Hays says participating in Shedd's volunteer action days on Valentine's Day is her "love letter" to nature. " srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/22f4868/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/e769c8e/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6724x3774+0+355/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Fc8%2Fc4%2Fce694f074eef8fc943a219055b2c%2Fvalentinerage-260215.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Abbey Hays says participating in Shedd’s volunteer action days on Valentine’s Day is her “love letter” to nature. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Pat Nabong/Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>As for Valentine’s Day, she said she had “mixed feelings.”</p><p>“I'm happy for everybody who gets to celebrate with the people they love,” she said. “But for some people, it's just a day, and you get to do whatever you want with that day.”<br></p>
entries.author: Erica Thompson

entries.title: Horoscope for Sunday, February 15, 2026
entries.summary: <h2>Moon Alert</h2> <p>After 12:45 a.m., there are no restrictions to shopping or important decisions. The moon is in Aquarius.</p><h2>Aries (March 21-April 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Friendships are unpredictable today. Someone might do something that catches you off guard, or you might meet someone who is a real character — someone different — someone older, sensitive and poetic or mysterious in some way.</p><h2>Taurus (April 20-May 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Tread carefully when dealing with bosses, parents and the police because people might react to your behavior. Or in turn, you might be surprised by the behavior of others. You won't like restrictions being placed on you today.</p><h2>Gemini (May 21-June 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Travel plans might change suddenly, or you might be surprised by news in the media. You might also react in a rebellious way to rules and regulations related to the church, schools, or a social institution. You feel you want to do your own thing.</p><h2>Cancer (June 21-July 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Double-check banking details and anything to do with shared property, inheritances, taxes and debt, because something unusual or unexpected might be happening. Stay on top of things because, hey, you snooze, you lose. Play it safe.</p><h2>Leo (July 23-Aug. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> A partner, spouse or close friend might throw you a curveball today. Alternatively, someone older might have advice for you, especially practical and financial recommendations. But if this advice is suspect — ignore it. Don't jump at anything. Wait a day or two to give everything a second, sober thought.</p><h2>Virgo (Aug. 23-Sept. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Your work routine will be interrupted today. This could be due to technological problems and computer glitches. However, power outages and staff shortages might also be at play. Despite this, you might still get a lot done because you are committed and focused.</p><h2>Libra (Sept. 23-Oct. 22)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Parents should be extra vigilant today because this is an accident-prone day for your kids. Know where they are at all times, no matter their age. Meanwhile, social events might suddenly change. They could be canceled, delayed, or suddenly initiated. Stay light on your feet so you can be ready to jump in either direction.</p><h2>Scorpio (Oct. 23-Nov. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> There's a strong possibility that your home routine will be interrupted today. Small appliances might break down. Something minor might break as well, or unexpected company at the door might catch you off guard. Be patient to avoid family arguments. There could be confusion dealing with someone older. Stay mellow.</p><h2>Sagittarius (Nov. 22-Dec. 21)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> It's important to know that this is an accident-prone day for you. Of course, an accident doesn't have to happen, but be aware that the vibes are there, and you have to pay attention to everything you say and do. Also, be careful not to blurt out something you might later regret.</p><h2>Capricorn (Dec. 22-Jan. 19)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Something unexpected could impact your wealth, assets, possessions and earnings today. Be aware of this. Check your online banking. On the upside, you might have a brilliant moneymaking idea. Someone older might have advice for you, but it might be fuzzy advice.</p><h2>Aquarius (Jan. 20-Feb. 18)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-7b0000" name="html-embed-module-7b0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>A <b>positive</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Be careful, because a sudden argument might break out today. You might feel resentful or even rebellious if someone tries to restrict your actions or ways of doing something. Your personal freedom is important to you today, that's for sure. If someone gives you advice, take it with a grain of salt.</p><h2>Pisces (Feb. 19-March 20)</h2> <p></p> <div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="HtmlModule"><a class="AnchorLink" id="html-embed-module-4d0000" name="html-embed-module-4d0000"></a><div class="HoroscopeStarbox HoroscopeStarbox_five"> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_container"> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> <svg class="HoroscopeStar"><use xlink:href="#icon-star"></use></svg> </div> <div class="HoroscopeStarbox_description"> <p>An <b>average</b> day</p> </div> </div> <style> .HoroscopeStarbox { background: #f8f8f8; display: flex; align-items: center; } .HoroscopeStarbox_container { display: grid; grid-gap: 5px; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr 1fr; padding: 20px; width: 40%; min-width: 160px; max-width: 200px; } .HoroscopeStarbox_description { padding: 20px; font-family: var(--font-1); font-size: var(--body-2); } .HoroscopeStarbox_container svg { object-fit: cover; aspect-ratio: 1 / 1; width: 100%; } </style> </div> </div><p> Although this is a restless day for you, with both Mercury and Venus in your sign, you'll be clear, diplomatic and charming. However, situations around you, or something going on behind the scenes, might be chaotic and unpredictable. If in doubt, do nothing.</p><h2>If today is your birthday</h2><p>Actress Alex Borstein (1971) shares your birthday today. You're charming, enthusiastic and kind. You value your friends and seek stimulation and adventure. Take inventory of your life this year because it's the last year of a nine-year cycle. Let go of people, places and things that held you back. Do some internal and external housecleaning. </p>
entries.author: Georgia Nicols

entries.title: Chicago teen who battled cancer while fighting for father's release from ICE detention dies
entries.summary: <p>Ofelia Giselle Torres Hidaldo, a Chicago teen who successfully fought for her father's release from federal immigration detainment, died Friday after battling a rare and aggressive form of cancer, according to a news release. </p><p>Ofelia, a junior at Lake View High School, had been battling metastatic alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma, a rare soft tissue cancer, since December 2024. Last year, the cancer progressed to stage 4 and she began receiving chemotherapy treatments. </p><p>One day after she was released for the weekend from Lurie Children's Hospital to see family and friends in mid-October, her father, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/immigration/2025/10/25/ruben-torres-maldonado-daughter-battling-cancer-judge-ruling" >Ruben Torres Maldonado, was detained</a> by ICE agents in Niles. <a class="Link" href="https://www.suntimeswire.com/2025/10/25/ruben-torres-maldonado-daughter-battling-cancer-judge-ruling" >Doctors said</a> she was unable to continue treatment "because of the stress and disruption" caused by the arrest. </p><p>Following widespread demands for his release, including <a class="Link" href="https://www.instagram.com/reels/DP-PGMHjWQ-/" target="_blank" >a video made by Ofelia</a> on social media, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/immigration/2025/10/30/chicago-father-of-teen-battling-rare-cancer-ordered-released-from-ice-custody" >Maldonado was released on bond</a> from U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement detention in late-October. </p><p>"Ofelia was heroic and brave in the face of ICE's detention and threatened deportation of her father," said Kalman Resnick, the attorney representing Torres, in a statement Saturday. "We mourn Ofelia's passing, and we hope that she will serve as a model for us all for how to be courageous and to fight for what's right to our last breaths."</p><p>On Tuesday, an immigration judge in Chicago conditionally entitled her father to receive a "cancellation of removal," due to the impact his deportation would have on his children who are citizens in the U.S. According to the news release, this would provide him with a pathway to lawful permanent residency and eventually U.S. citizenship. </p><p>Ofelia was able to watch her father's hearing via Zoom. </p><p>A <a class="Link" href="https://www.gofundme.com/f/stand-with-ofelia-support-her-family-now" target="_blank" >GoFundMe</a> page was started for Ofelia in October and has collected more than $119,000. </p>
entries.author: Elleiana Green

entries.title: Dear Abby: Girlfriend taking new romance as slow as possible
entries.summary: <p><b>DEAR ABBY:</b> I have been dating "Rita" for four months. We peck on the lips, hug and hold hands, but we have had only one real kiss so far. Rita was first married for 22 years to an emotionally abusive man and then remarried to a manipulative one. She said we were going too fast and she wanted to slow down. I understood and have exerted no pressure on her.</p><p>Rita has canceled dates for various reasons and gone silent for a day here and there. She says she's not talking to anyone else, and neither am I. I have told her she is worth the wait. I have fallen hard for her and have serious intentions about her.</p><p>Rita says she has strong feelings for me and that I treat her better than any man she has ever been involved with, but she doesn't know how to handle the feelings. How long should I give her to figure out what she wants this relationship to be?</p><p>I'm not worried about sex or anything like that, but four months without even calling us "dating" or "girlfriend and boyfriend" has me worried that I am, for a lack of a better description, wasting my time with her. What would you advise me to do? — <i>TAKING IT SLOW IN VIRGINIA</i></p><p><b>DEAR TAKING IT SLOW:</b> Continue allowing your relationship with Rita to develop slowly. The woman has had two unsuccessful marriages, so it's no wonder she's slow to commit. If, after a year (eight months from now), Rita still feels uncomfortable calling you "boyfriend" or "companion," revisit the conversation and decide then if you have invested enough time.</p><p><b>DEAR ABBY:</b> After reading so many horrible letters sent to you from people about their mothers-in-law, I feel compelled to write to you about mine. I met her 43 years ago when I was dating her oldest son (now my husband). From the moment we met, she treated me with caring, acceptance and love. She and my father-in-law raised five amazing children, and they treated their children's spouses as if we were their own. She devoted her entire life to caring for and nurturing her husband, children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren.</p><p>Unfortunately, we just lost this beautiful woman at the age of 89 to a long and difficult battle with Parkinson's and dementia. We watched her "sparkle" slowly fade away, but we will carry her amazing legacy with us always. I hope I can be half the MIL to my children's spouses that she was to me.</p><p>I also hope that all those who aren't as lucky as I was can find some common ground with their mothers-in-law — especially if there are children involved. I LOVE YOU, MOM! — <i>FORTUNATE IN NEW YORK</i></p><p><b>DEAR FORTUNATE:</b> Thank you for sharing this beautiful tribute to a woman who made such a positive difference in the lives of those she touched. Not only were you fortunate to be a member of such a warm and loving family, but she was also lucky to have a daughter-in-law like you.</p><p><i>Dear Abby is written by Abigail Van Buren, also known as Jeanne Phillips, and was founded by her mother, Pauline Phillips. Contact Dear Abby at www.DearAbby.com or P.O. Box 69440, Los Angeles, CA 90069.</i></p><p>To order "How to Write Letters for All Occasions," send your name and mailing address, plus check or money order for $8 (U.S. funds) to: Dear Abby — Letter Booklet, P.O. Box 446, Kings Mills, OH 45034-0446. (Shipping and handling are included in the price.)</p>
entries.author: Abigail Van Buren

entries.title: As road construction season approaches, uncertainty remains over contractor with ties to Palumbo family
entries.summary: <p>With another road construction season fast approaching, a suburban contractor with ties to the Palumbo family is still not allowed to work on Illinois Department of Transportation projects.</p><p>But not for a lack of trying.</p><p>Builders Paving LLC continues to pursue IDOT road contracts — even though the agency won’t formally award them to the company when it’s the apparent low bidder or allow ground breaking.</p><p>Recently, Builders submitted what appears to be the best proposal to handle four projects IDOT is overseeing or otherwise involved in:<br></p><ul class="rte2-style-ul" id="rte-935ff942-0837-11f1-a8cf-4d09f9e82e48"><li>Maple Avenue from Brookfield Avenue to 31st Street in west suburban Brookfield.</li><li>U.S. 45 from Illinois 176 to Woodlawn Drive in far north suburban Mundelein.</li><li>Illinois 43 from U.S. 14 to Oakton Street in near north suburban Niles and Morton Grove.</li><li>Mittel Boulevard from Thorndale Avenue to Devon Avenue in west suburban Wood Dale.</li></ul><p>Their collective price tag is around $5.7 million.</p><p>That’s <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/10/12/illinois-department-of-transportation-road-construction-pritzker-palumbo-builders-paving" target="_blank" >atop more than $50 million in projects</a> Builders already believes it’s entitled to but hasn’t been awarded since late 2024.</p><p>That’s when IDOT “paused” new contract awards to the Hillside business as it launched an internal investigation, trying to figure out whether Sebastian “Sam” Palumbo was secretly involved in the company and, if so, how.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-fe0000" name="image-fe0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/a17d310/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/4a67bec/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d023e45/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png" alt="Sebastian "Sam" Palumbo." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d023e45/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/9789c05/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/d023e45/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1000x561+0+505/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2Ff4%2Fa2%2F607c2489459b8002030cf40f4cda%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-12-at-11-51-22-am.png" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Sebastian “Sam” Palumbo.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Provided</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>Palumbo was forever banned from state and federal projects after he and several other construction firms were caught up in a massive fraud case in the 1990s that revealed taxpayers, and employees, were ripped off. Palumbo, a brother and their father did prison time.</p><p>If Palumbo is found to have violated that ban, the potential repercussions for him or Builders aren’t clear.</p><p>An attorney for Palumbo and Builders has insisted Palumbo has nothing to do with Builders, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2024/12/20/road-construction-builders-paving-asphalt-sam-palumbo-brothers-debarred-illinois" target="_blank" >whose executives include a Palumbo daughter and her husband</a>.</p><p>Builders <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2025/06/06/palumbo-builders-paving-hillside-illinois-transportation-governor-pritzker-construction-roads" target="_blank" >sued IDOT last year</a> to try to force the agency to lift the brick on the contracts, saying the company “has a clear legal right” to the ones on hold, with IDOT “legally required to award” them “to Builders Paving within 45 days of bid submission.”</p><p>“There is no justification under the Illinois Procurement Code or applicable regulations for IDOT to withhold awarding the Contracts,” and Builders could suffer “irreparable injury” if there’s “an indeterminate, unexplained and unjustified delay in the award of millions of dollars in Contracts to Builders Paving.”</p><p>Last month, <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/the-watchdogs/2026/01/09/cook-county-judge-sebastian-sam-palumbo-gandy-builders-paving-illinois-department-of-transportation" target="_blank" >a Cook County judge ruled otherwise</a>, writing: “The Court finds that the provisions highlighted by IDOT negate the existence of a ministerial obligation to award the contracts by providing that no bidder has a right to a State contract absent execution, that the State is under no obligation to issue an award, and that IDOT retains authority to reject any or all bids or cancel a solicitation in the State’s best interests.”</p><p>Builders attorney William Dwyer Jr. told the Chicago Sun-Times that the company hasn’t filed an appeal, but has filed paperwork signaling the intent to do so “to preserve its right to appeal the judge’s ruling."</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-810000" name="image-810000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/71146bb/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1414x794+0+74/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1a%2Fc7%2F6d25935146229a90b605b104e095%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-11-at-12-39-13-pm.png 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/363e371/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1414x794+0+74/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1a%2Fc7%2F6d25935146229a90b605b104e095%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-11-at-12-39-13-pm.png alt="The Hillside offices of Builders Paving LLC and its sister companies." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ffba2ac/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1414x794+0+74/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1a%2Fc7%2F6d25935146229a90b605b104e095%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-11-at-12-39-13-pm.png 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/0d2be53/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1414x794+0+74/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1a%2Fc7%2F6d25935146229a90b605b104e095%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-11-at-12-39-13-pm.png 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/ffba2ac/2147483647/strip/true/crop/1414x794+0+74/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F1a%2Fc7%2F6d25935146229a90b605b104e095%2Fscreenshot-2026-02-11-at-12-39-13-pm.png" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>The Hillside offices of Builders Paving LLC and its sister companies.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Robert Herguth / Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“Builders’ goal has always been to resolve any issue with IDOT by responding to any questions IDOT has and supplying any information requested. Builders has done so and will continue to do so in the hope that all issues can soon be resolved.”</p><p>Neither Builders nor IDOT would answer questions about whether a settlement is possible to resolve this dispute.</p><p>Road construction season traditionally begins in April, which is also when local asphalt plants often start reopening, an IDOT spokeswoman says.</p><p>The start dates on the four projects Builders was the apparent low bidder on “are unknown until the contracts are executed,” she says. “However, presumably a late spring/early summer start.”</p><p>Brookfield’s village engineer, Derek Treichel of Hancock Engineering, says of his community’s resurfacing project: “We were hoping to start work in April.”</p><p>“Right now we have no estimate” of a launch date, “we don’t even know if it’ll happen this year.”</p><p>Besides being an inconvenience, Treichel says “the risk of increased cost” associated with any delay “is a real concern.”</p><p>He said IDOT resisted the suggestion that — to get the Brookfield project rolling — the agency scrap the Builders bid and go with the next-best proposal, which was around $14,000 higher.</p><p>A Niles municipal official says, “We have not received any information from IDOT regarding the anticipated construction schedule or any changes to the project.”</p>
entries.author: Robert Herguth
